body:
### Problem

When calling `nvim_get_proc` in `--cmd` it breaks the setting of `gcr=` from the init file.

This was originally reported @weitcis  for nvimpager in https://github.com/lucc/nvimpager/issues/84

### Steps to reproduce

I was able to reproduce this problem with xterm, alacritty and kitty. I used these terminals because I can define the cursor shape from the command line with
- `xterm -barc`
- `alacritty -o cursor.style=Beam`
- `kitty -o cursor_shape=beam`

others might work as well.

Setting `gcr=` before calling `nvim_get_proc` works as expected and the cursor is the beam we defined in the terminal options:
~~~sh
xterm -barc -e nvim --clean -u NONE --cmd 'se gcr=' --cmd 'echo nvim_get_proc(1)'
xterm -barc -e nvim --clean -u NONE -c    'se gcr=' -c    'echo nvim_get_proc(1)'
xterm -barc -e nvim --clean -u NONE --cmd 'se gcr=' -c    'echo nvim_get_proc(1)'
~~~

Calling `nvim_get_proc` before setting `gcr=` turns the cursor into a solid block even though the termial sets it to a beam:
~~~sh
xterm -barc -e nvim --clean -u NONE --cmd 'echo nvim_get_proc(1)' --cmd 'se gcr='
xterm -barc -e nvim --clean -u NONE -c    'echo nvim_get_proc(1)' -c    'se gcr='
xterm -barc -e nvim --clean -u NONE --cmd 'echo nvim_get_proc(1)' -c    'se gcr='
~~~

The same can be demonstrated when putting both commands in an init file in the respective order:
~~~sh
(echo se gcr=; echo 'call nvim_get_proc(1)') > good.vim
(echo 'call nvim_get_proc(1)'; echo se gcr=) > bad.vim
xterm -barc -e nvim --clean -u good.vim
xterm -barc -e nvim --clean -u bad.vim
~~~

And also when one is in an init file and the other in a --cmd or -c option
respectively (to many combinations).


### Expected behavior

`set gcr=` should leave the cursor in the state set by the terminal regardless if and when `nvim_get_proc` is called.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.8.1 & 0.8.2 & 0.8.3 & 0.9 & v0.10.0-dev-54dab9e

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

n/a

### Operating system/version

Linux / NixOS

### Terminal name/version

xterm 379, alacritty 0.12.0, kitty 0.27.1, 

### $TERM environment variable

xterm, alacritty, xterm-kitty

### Installation

from nixpkgs (official distro package)

comment_data.body: I think the problem here is not processing events, but UI flush, as `:redraw` also causes the issue even though it doesn't process events. Related #25377

title: if UI flush happens before the 'guicursor' is set, 'guicursor' is broken.
